title: Quantifiers: 'few', 'a few', 'little' and 'a bit of'
introduction: Do you know how to use a few, few, very little and a bit of? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
explanation: A few and a bit of or a little mean some. Often we feel this amount is enough or more than we expected. We use a few with plural nouns and a bit of or a little with uncountable nouns.
rules: We use few and very little to show that we are talking about a small amount.
keyPoints: you can use little without very, but it is less common and sounds quite formal
examples: Do you know how to use a few, few, very little and a bit of?
Look at these examples to see how these quantifiers are used with countable and uncountable nouns.
I have a few friends, so I'm not lonely.
She has few friends, so she's quite lonely.
There are few places where you can still see these birds.
